post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: Has anyone else tried the beta yet? I haven't played Quake 3 in years but this will definitely get me back into it.

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body: I still play Quake 3, atleast once a week offline and once a week online. Can't wait to try this out.

post.author: gavavva
post.body: Yeah, I'm playing in it. Its damn good guys, all the Q3/TA content, but tweaked to perfection. Q3DM17's been 100% re-done and its amazing.

post.body: I'm very pleased.

post.body: I'm really excited about this.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
ViPr wrote:
i saw a video of it and it appears to have been germanized.


Whatever that means - they drive reliable cars now? You can play football? It's all black, red and gold? You have to pay 42% income tax on a frag? Women go unveiled? Everyone got health care?

post.author: wal
post.body:
They all walk around wearing Lederhosen and drinking beer? They spawn in before everyone else and place towels over all the best weapons? They win football matches despite not being able to play that well. They always sound angry?

Sorry, couldn't resist

post.author: obsidian
post.body:
I'm liking it. I can't say much due to the non-disclosure agreement. But it's basically Quake III Arena, except in a browser, but spiffed up with lots of polish and a few new tricks, maps, etc.

I wish I could help out with it though... I'd do it for free! Q3Map2 has come a long way since Q3 was first released and I have lots of tricks up my sleeve that will make things really pop.

post.author: kat
post.body:
They are supposed to be using Q3map2, or at least ZeroRadiant has Ydnar in it's credits so I'd have assumed they were extending what used to happen with the inbuilt compiler choices?

I'd *hope* that right now all they're doing is 'choosing' the maps to include which might then get a recompile? I definitely agree with you that they should 'update' the levels with newer Q3Map2 features. Send um an e-mail obsidian, they do know who you are so you never know

post.author: ViPr
post.body: i was referring to the german government's apparent desire to portray war & killing as not horrific, as if they were preparing to gear up for a repeat of their past.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
BNA! wrote:
Import penalty tax on spare parts
(or better - we build in EURO but have to sell in severely depreciated USD after shipping cost)


he said cuz it's a V6 & most VW's are turbo 4's. Loves his car though. But I'm sure the importing has something to do with it (no el-cheapo parts for imports here!)


Yes, it's importing and especially the weak USD. VW however will built a large fab in the US now as a natural hedge against these two specific issues. And by September Porsche will overtake VW, that should help in the long run in terms of productivity and additional quality increase.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
ViPr wrote:
i was referring to the german government's apparent desire to portray war & killing as not horrific, as if they were preparing to gear up for a repeat of their past.


You have no clue. It is not allowed to portray cruelty in a glorifying, distorting or self serving purpose type of way in Germany to prevent a repeating of the past. Most people get that wrong about Germany, which, as far as I am concerned, is fine. The reason for this is that people should not link cruelty and violence (excessive blood, dismemberment...) with fun (like in computer games) to prevent society from acting sensible. You can pretty much compare it to the amount of billboards with naked women in the UAE.

post.author: lowdragon

post.author: Wobbo
post.body:
BNA! wrote:
ViPr wrote:
You have no clue. It is not allowed to portray cruelty in a glorifying, distorting or self serving purpose type of way in Germany to prevent a repeating of the past. Most people get that wrong about Germany, which, as far as I am concerned, is fine. The reason for this is that people should not link cruelty and violence (excessive blood, dismemberment...) with fun (like in computer games) to prevent society from acting sensible. .

Censorship is *NEVER* sensible. Video games are just as much art as paintings books, and other forms of speech/expression. The whole "cruelty" argument is totally bogus. Boxing is fun, and in fact a major sport in Germany - would anyone seriously argue that the sport of Boxing is not violent?

Its apparent that Germany - and Europe in general - still does not understand the most basic concepts of freedom of speech - which is sad because the Enlightenment mostly occurred over there. To quote Voltaire "I may hate what you have to say, but I will die to defend your right to say it."

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: QuakeLive Beta on one hand, Violence and Germany in the other. Whatever next? Rage Beta and World Peace!

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Wobbo wrote:
Its apparent that Germany - and Europe in general - still does not understand the most basic concepts of freedom of speech - which is sad because the Enlightenment mostly occurred over there. To quote Voltaire "I may hate what you have to say, but I will die to defend your right to say it."


Nipplegate. Just different standards. The foundation of "censorship" in Germany was instituted by the Allied forces after WW2. I rest my case.
